wikipedia_page.main:
Mick Stallard (1944–2002) was an English racing cyclist. 
The son of world champion cyclist Percy Stallard, he won the British National Cyclo-cross Championship three times in a row (1963–65), and then had a brief career (1966–68) as a professional road racer with the Falcon Cycles team.After retiring from racing, Stallard had his own bike shop in Bradmore . He died on 6 April 2002.
